segments.text: I notice the woman drying the plate with such care, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the sink flows like a small river towards the floor, and it’s astonishing how she doesn’t see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a bit sad for her; she seems so focused on her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sight of the boy on that stool makes my stomach drop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he loses his balance? It’s a dangerous game he’s playing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands by like an eager puppy, waiting for her cookie, her face lighting up with anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how innocent their intentions are, but they have no idea of the risks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen feels so cozy, yet there’s an undercurrent of tension I can't ignore.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel angry at the thought of the mother missing the signs of mischief behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s ironic; she’s trying to create a lovely home yet overlooks the dangers at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If the stool tips, it could really hurt the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I glance at the garden outside and wonder if that peacefulness can penetrate this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will she ever realize what’s happening right under her nose?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation just feels so fragile, like everything is on the brink of a mishap.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how easy it is to be lost in daily routines and miss the bigger picture.
segments.speaker: PAR
